alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:10AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Warren, Henderson, McDonough, Hancock, southern Henry, central Des Moines, southeastern Van Buren, Lee, northern Clark and northeastern Scotland Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 209 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Bonaparte to 7 miles west of Colmar. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and half inch hail from the stronger storms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Colmar around 220 AM CDT. Tennessee around 225 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Colchester, Blandinsville, Macomb, Salem, St. Paul, Western Illinois University, Pilot Grove, Good Hope, Sciota, Lowell and Mount Pleasant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Van Buren
